fun.connor.lighter.declarative

Annotation Type ResourceController


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface ResourceController
    Identifies the annotated class as a Resource Controller. Resource Controllers are the only types which can have endpoint handler methods. Typically, a Resource Controller represents a controller for a specific type in the application domain. Resource Controllers must provide a unique path fragment that constrains the paths of its endpoint handler methods. The path template fragment defined by the Resource Controller is prepended to the path templates of each of its endpoint handler methods.

    Path templates follow a simple syntax. For paths that do not have any parameters, the template looks exactly like the path. For example, the path template:

        /foo/bar/123

    will match only the exact path

        /foo/bar/123

    For paths with parameters, use curly braces ({}) wrapped around the parameter name to identify it as a parameter. Parameters are bound to endpoint handler method parameters that have the same name. No two parameters in a path can have the same name. Legal names for path parameters are the same as legal names for Java method parameters. There is no way to identify the type of the parameter in the path template. Instead, Lighter infers the template parameter type from the method signature of endpoint handler method. Thus, paths cannot be differentiated from eachother using the type or name of their template parameters.
    An example of path with parameters:

        /foo/bar/{id}

    This template will match any path that starts with /foo/bar and has exactly 3 components. The third component of the path will be bound to the method parameter with the name "id". Lighter will use the configured TypeAdapter to attempt to deserialize the parameter from the path. Path parameters are assigned a IANA Media type of "text/plain".

    All of these rules are enforced by the compiler.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String value
      Defines the path fragment which this method can respond to.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        Defines the path fragment which this method can respond to. Defaults to an empty path.
